image.altText: President Putin and President Prabowo seated on ornate golden chairs facing each other at a meeting in Moscow.

props.synopsis: A US report says Russia has put in a request to station long-range aircraft on an Indonesian air force base relatively close to the Australian mainland.

title.children: Canberra scrambling to confirm reports of Putin's new Indo-Pacific play

image.altText: Man in a suit talking to media

props.synopsis: Australia is in contact with Indonesia about reports Russia is seeking a base there. Follow live.

title.children: PM investigating reports Russia wants to base aircraft in Indonesia

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Reports of Russian aircraft at Indonesian air base 'simply not true' says Richard Marles
BREAKING: Richard Marles assured there will be no Russian planes in Indonesia
Dutton says Coalition will cut free TAFE

image.altText: a young man wearing hi-vis and a hard hat next to his dad wearing the same

props.synopsis: Harry Dutton joined his father for a second press opportunity on Tuesday, the prime minister said Tanya Plibersek would get a "senior" cabinet job if Labor was re-elected and an MP has compared his peer to a dog.

title.children: There's a universal rule on politics and kids  — and this week Dutton broke it

image.altText: A close up of a Chinese man's face

props.synopsis: The timing of his tour through South-East Asia couldn't be better for Xi, who is trying to court as many countries as possible to form a united diplomatic front against Trump's tariffs.

title.children: 'How do we screw the USA?' Why Trump is annoyed at Xi's Asia tour

image.altText: Jordan looking at a real estate sign out front of a house.

props.synopsis: With home ownership more out of reach than ever for younger Australians, some are pondering whether their retirement fund would be better off used now, to buy a house.

title.children: Is a home deposit now worth thousands in lost super at retirement?

image.altText: Green text on a green background that reads "The Greens Party Party".

props.synopsis: The West Australian Greens have dumped plans to host the event on Anzac Day off the back of widespread criticism from veterans and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: 'Read the room': WA Greens reschedule Anzac Day dance party fundraiser

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Australia's dollar has recovered from last week's heavy losses, and the ASX200 has closed up modestly. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Dollar recovers from pummelling, ASX closes higher — as it happened

image.altText: A woooden mail box with the number 33 stands in the middle of an empty block

props.synopsis: New data shows dozens of suburbs around the country are at risk of becoming uninsurable, triggering warnings of a "climate-induced credit crunch".

title.children: Climate risk could make these Australian suburbs 'uninsurable'

image.altText: Two people look at the statue of liberty

props.synopsis: As the Trump administration continues its crackdown on border security, more Australians appear to be avoiding the US.

title.children: Fewer Australians travelling to US amid 'scary' border security crackdown

image.altText: Male and female police officers carrying backpacks and bags exit a home and walk down stairs at night time.

props.synopsis: The 65-year-old woman was inside the Ambarvale house at the time of the attack and died after sustaining a wound to her leg.

title.children: 'Abhorrent': 65yo grandmother killed in Sydney drive-by shooting

image.altText: The Star, formally known as Star City Casino, Sydney.

props.synopsis: Casino firm Star Entertainment pulled back from the brink of collapse thanks to a deal with US giant Bally's and pub billionaire Bruce Mathieson. Now its shares are set to return to trade, after it posted a steeper-than-expected financial fall.

title.children: Star posts $300m loss as it attempts turnaround

image.altText: a male politician speaking at a press conference flanked by a man and a woman

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is refusing to say how much he wants Australian house prices to rise, as Labor remains tight-lipped on the impacts of its first home buyer policy on the housing market.

title.children: Dutton doubles down on housing, as Labor stays quiet on policy modelling

image.altText: Virginia Trioli and Tim Minchin both smile widely sitting at a piano with the ocean behind them.

props.synopsis: Tim Michin's career has evolved from working as a jobbing musician to winning major awards for his Broadway and West End musical, Matilda. But he's still driven by seeing how much he can make his audiences feel.

title.children: Tim Minchin doesn't want to be 'stuck in one mode my whole life'

image.altText: Officers in forensics uniforms outside a house.

props.synopsis: A court has heard the events surrounding the opioid overdose deaths of four people in Melbourne's northern suburbs last year.

title.children: Neighbours recount frantic discovery of four dead in Melbourne overdose

image.altText: A black gun on a piece of plastic that reads Australian Federal Police

props.synopsis: A teacher is being investigated after police say they brought a 3D-printed gun to a Canberra school, in what they believe may have been a “misguided effort to demonstrate the capabilities of 3D printing”.

title.children: ACT teacher allegedly brings 3D-printed firearm to school

image.altText: A man looks through prison bars.

props.synopsis: To survive the Syrian prison known as the "human slaughterhouse", Moaz had to live a lie. Then it got real.

title.children: Moaz faked being a doctor. Then he was asked to do something terrifying

image.altText: A group of elephants huddle together during an earthquake.

props.synopsis: This "alert circle" is a natural response to perceived threats, with elephants having the ability to feel sounds through their feet.

title.children: Zoo elephants huddle to protect calves during San Diego earthquake

image.altText: Aerial view into a car showing a driver resting a mobile phone on their lap

props.synopsis: Police have issued more than 46,000 fines in six months to Adelaide drivers caught using mobile phones and are "disappointed" at the number of repeat offenders – including one driver detected 41 times.

title.children: Driver caught on mobile phone detection cameras 41 times

image.altText: A multi-storey brick building bearing letters that read "Base Hospital".

props.synopsis: Victorian mother of two Karla Lee Jordan was 50 years old when she died by her own hand in 2019. A coronial inquest has found she was subject to long-term stress in a workplace plagued with cultural issues.

title.children: Toxic culture contributed to hospital worker taking own life, coroner finds

image.altText: Scarborough suburban house fire

props.synopsis: A woman in her 30s is taken to hospital after being rescued from a suspicious house fire in the beachside Perth suburb of Scarborough.

title.children: 'Suspicious' house fire in Scarborough leaves woman with burns

image.altText: a male politician wearing a collared shirt and tie next to a woman wearing a green shirt

props.synopsis: One of the National Party's top hopes for an election pick-up in Western Australia has blasted the Coalition's opposition to Labor's resources production tax credits, saying "good policy deserves support".

title.children: Nationals hopeful pans Coalition rejection of Labor's mining tax sweetener

props.synopsis: China has been the main target of Donald Trump and his big tariffs. But can the world’s second largest economy weather the storm and even win the trade war against the United States?

title.children: How China could win Trump’s trade war

image.altText: Donald Trump and Nayib Bukele stand at a White House entrance.

props.synopsis: As world leaders scramble to get the ear of US President Donald Trump, the self-described "world's coolest dictator" scores a coveted White House meeting.

title.children: 'World's coolest dictator' meets Trump after jailing US deportees

image.altText: Phones on display along a table

props.synopsis: After the Trump administration exempted smartphones and semiconductors from tariffs on Friday, the president backtracked and warned no one was "getting off the hook".

title.children: Confusion over chip, smartphone tariffs unfolds in US

image.altText: A man with dyed blonde hair with black roots in a white collared shirt stands outside near a tall glass apartment building.

props.synopsis: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

title.children: Voters unhappy negative gearing, stamp duty not on horizon this election

image.altText: Lachlan Galvin playing for Wests Tigers in a preseason match against Parramatta.

props.synopsis: Only one day after Wests Tigers confirmed he would be leaving the club when his contract expires, Lachlan Galvin is left out of their squad for the Easter Monday clash against Parramatta.

title.children: Galvin dropped by Wests Tigers a day after knocking back contract extension

image.altText: Lady Gaga stands outstretched with a white cape flowing. She wears some armour mixed in with a white linen outfit.

props.synopsis: The highs, lows and biggest surprises from the most talked about music festival on the planet.

title.children: Lady Gaga dazzles Coachella while Amyl and the Sniffers get political

image.altText: A sun setting behind clouds at Lake Menindee in outback NSW.

props.synopsis: As a mass of water makes its way down from Queensland, the Menindee Lakes in outback New South Wales could be the beneficiary. Having slowly dried up for months, the fortunes of the bird and fish sanctuary may be about to change.

title.children: Up to 1 trillion litres of floodwater heading for Menindee Lakes in outback NSW

image.altText: a close-up of an ankle monitoring device worn by a man

props.synopsis: Roger Cook says the courts should keep accused perpetrators "behind bars", as the state's authorities concede they can't electronically monitor people in regional areas.

title.children: DV accused in GPS tracking blind spots should be jailed, premier says

image.altText: Uncle Carey wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: A large majority of Aboriginal community-owned health facilities in Victoria are in urgent need of infrastructure funding, according to a new report from the state's top advisory body and peak body for Indigenous health.

title.children: Indigenous elders say crumbling health facilities are fracturing community

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron, Zak Butters and Eric Hipwood celebrate goals

props.synopsis: The AFL is ripe with some fresh contenders this season, but Gather Round shows they won't simply be able to stroll their way to the premiership without experiencing some growing pains.

title.children: Ominous warning from AFL's old guard to new contenders

image.altText: Two brunette young people stand in a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Two years after season one, dystopian zombie series The Last of Us has finally returned for another bite.

title.children: The Last of Us stars on season two's big twist

image.altText: A young homeless person sits on a park bench with their back to the camera. You cannot see their face.

props.synopsis: Every four days a homeless person aged between 15 and 24 dies, and the majority of deaths are due to suicide.

title.children: Every four days a young homeless person dies. Advocates want urgent reform

image.altText: Rory McIlroy smiles wearing a green jacket

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy earned praise from across the world of sport and politics after his sensational Masters victory at Augusta on Monday cemented him as one of golf's all-time greats.

title.children: Rory McIlroy earns wide praise after showstopping Masters win
